alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 20 at 10:59AM HST until December 20 at 2:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 200 PM HST. * At 1059 AM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated that persistent moderate to heavy rainfall over windward slopes has led to rapid rises in streams and rivers. Flooding of the Hanalei River has led to the closure of Kuhio Highway near Hanalei. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... northern, eastern and portions of southern Kauai. This warning may need to be extended beyond 200 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry.
